report.summary: Possible Bug - Lockscreen
report.label: bug
report.description: I have noticed that often when i disconnect my earbuds and then reconnect them the lockscreen controls disappear and i have to force close and restart the app to get them back. Any idea what is causing this?

report.summary: Playlist jumps to the first entry when an episode is listened.
report.label: bug
report.description: When you play an episode from the play list which isn't the first or last, a "bug" appears when you finished one episode. Normally play lists are played from the top to the bottom, no matter where you start. but AntennaPod jumps to the first entry every time you finished an episode, no matter which item is played. How it should be: If an episode is listened, the next (means the under lying entry) episode should be played.

report.summary: Video: control bar animation looks wrong
report.label: bug
report.description: If you tab on a video to show the controls, the lower bar moves in from above. That's why there is a white block which appears when the bar is moving. The control bar should move up from the buttom of the screen.

report.summary: Wrong episode downloaded in "Display only episodes" mode
report.label: bug
report.description: In version 0.9.5.1 (from FDroid, if that matters), if you enable the "Display only episodes" checkbox and then try to download (directly from the list of episodes, either for a single podcast or on the "New" tab) an episode that comes after where a hidden non-episode would have been, you either get the wrong file or no option to download at all. It's as if it's ignoring the "Display only episodes" option when working out which file to download.

report.summary: Podcast image not loading
report.label: bug
report.description: For the feed at http://podcast.hr-online.de/lateline/podcast.xml the image is not loading. That's not a bug in AntennaPod, because the feed is broken (it contains image tags with empty urls in every single item), but maybe it would be possible to work around that by ignoring image tags that aren't direct children of a channel element.

report.summary: New podcasts overwrite existing files if filenames coincide
report.label: bug
report.description: Some feeds give all their audio files the same name (e.g. http://rss.sciam.com/sciam/60-second-earth). This will lead to AntennaPod overwriting the existing audio file when a new episode is downloaded, so basically only one episode can be present at any time.

report.summary: Does not recover from failed file deletion.
report.label: bug
report.description: This just occured to me. I had my sd-card mounted in read-only mode (don't ask why) and antennaPod crashed when removing an item. when i restarted the app, the item was indeed removed, but still visible in /sdcard/Android/data/... I think it would be easy enough if AntennaPod first tries to delete the file, then remove it from the database. That way it will crash before it removes the item from the db.

report.summary: AntennaPod does not follow HTTP redirects
report.label: bug
report.description: I had a Podcast feed where AntednnaPod did not download an episode. It only returned HTTP status code 302 as error in the log. HTTP status code 302 denotes a redirect to a new location. AntennaPod should follow redirects in HTTP downloads.

report.summary: Problem with RSS feed
report.label: bug
report.description: I use Antennapod on two devices and on one of them, when I try to download a podcast episode, I receive the message "An error occurred when trying to donwload the file: Failed to access the external storage". Also, when I update the episodes list, the download fails and I receive the message "IO error: /mnt/sdcard/Android/data/de.danoeh.antennapod/files/cache/feed-CBN - Podcast - No Div√£ do Gikovate (Invalid argument)" On the other device, this feed works without any problem. I've already tried to exclude the feed and delete this cache directory but It didn't help although It seems like some cache or temporary files problem... Is there any other directory I may clean or exclude to try to make this feed work ? Thank you, Regards, Renato.

report.summary: AntennaPod forgets downloaded podcasts
report.label: bug
report.description: Sometimes the downloaded podcasts are forgotten. The download icon just disappears from the list. But in the download log it is still visible that the download was successful. If I look into the "Android/data/de.danoeh.antennapod/files/media" directory I can see that the file is there. I haven't found a way to reproduce this, but this problem happened at least on two different devices.

report.summary: Can't play audio from guardian.co.uk podcast
report.label: bug
report.description: I have used SparseRSS to play audio from this feed http://www.guardian.co.uk/global-development/series/global-development-podcast/rss but Antennapod doesn't allow one to play audio: it just shows the show notes.

report.summary: Doesn't check whether downloaded files still exist
report.label: bug
report.description: When you download an episode and delete the file via a filemanager AntennaPod thinks the file would stiill be there. If you want to play it it doesnt work, it hangs at "preparing" Please add a check whether the files are still present or not or at least add an option to redownload an episode

report.summary: Appears to have issues with gzip encoded feeds.
report.label: bug
report.description: EscapePod has recently updated their feeds to use gzip encoding on the feed results. http://feeds.escapeartists.net/EscapePod Looking at the results that come back thru the browser using Fiddler (http tracer) I see that the orginal URL redirects (302) to http://escapepod.org/feed/rss2 which redirects (301) to http://escapepod.org/feed/ all of these have HTTP header of Content-Encoding: gzip. Looking at the downloaded feed in the cache directory I can see that the feed is still gzipped rather than unzipped to plain text. Antenapod throws a "Download failed Unsupported Feed type: Invalid type" Let me know of you want HTTP tracings or the gzipped feeds. Regards Stuart

report.summary: AntennaPod starts playing audio on its own
report.label: bug
report.description: If I've been listening to a podcast and then pause it, sometimes at some point several minutes (or even hours) later AntennaPod will start playing the podcast all on its own. This isn't just pocket activation, it happens when it's sitting on my desk, or when I'm using it in the car. The usual situation is that I've been listening in the car or on headphones, I'll pause the playback, and then it will spontaneously start again a while later. This seems to happen regardless of whether something was plugged into the headphone jack during playback and both when playback has been paused normally and when it's been paused because the audio cable was unplugged. This happens in 0.9.6.4, and in the previous version. Please let me know what I can do to help via logs, etc. Sadly, I can't figure out how to reproduce the behavior, but it happens several times a week. I'm experiencing this issue on my Tmo Galaxy S3 running Cyanogenmod 10.0.0-d2tmo (Android 4.1.2).

report.summary: Regression in 0.9.6.3: Download of videos from "All CNET Video Podcasts (HD)" fails
report.label: bug
report.description: After upgrade from 0.9.6.2 to 0.9.6.3 (fdroid repo) videos from http://feeds.feedburner.com/cnet/allhdpodcast cannot be downloaded any more. The download fails almost immediately. After downgrade back to 0.9.6.2 the download works again.

report.summary: same title, different rss feed
report.label: bug
report.description: http://www.dradio.de/podcast/ dradio-kommentar: there are two rss feeds with the same name, mixedup @ import ->Edit title (request) one question: when do items expire? expert delete,archive,fav settings ;) regards Markus

report.summary: Overlay of the track list
report.label: bug
report.description: When I come back from track details this happens http://lh3.ggpht.com/-gBHCmW77-Eg/URLYR2jp7bI/AAAAAAAAADA/46pcBYVyQxM/s640/Screenshot_2013-02-07-00-21-27.png

report.summary: Can't see items when in Dark theme
report.label: bug
report.description: Switch to dark theme, Settings >> Select theme >> Dark View one of your feeds View an article The article contents are displayed with a white background and off-whiteish text so the text cannot be read! The background needs to be black/dark. Switch to light theme and all is ok, white background with dark text.

report.summary: Back button in Settings menu exits app
report.label: bug
report.description: If you press the Back button when in the Settings menu, the app exits. It should return you to the app's home screen.

report.summary: failing Downloads through shutdown wifi?
report.label: bug
report.description: Hi, I am experiencing lots of failed downloads on cm10.1 nightly on a Samsung Galaxy Nexus. I assume it's because the wifi gets turned of after not working with the phone. Is it possible, that AntennaPod "blocks" this while downloading something. Thanks a lot!

report.summary: Initial Flattr authorization does not work when using Chrome
report.label: bug
report.description: When using Chrome as the default Android browser, the Flattr authorization does not work. After pressing the "Authentifizieren" button in Antennapod, Chrome is opened with the correct Flattr page to allow the app access to the Flattr account. However, after entering the credentials, the page redirects to an flattr4j://de.danoeh... URL, which Chrome seemingly can't handle, resulting in an error 302 (net::ERR_UNKNOWN_URL_SCHEME).

report.summary: New feeds not working
report.label: bug
report.description: When I add new feeds they don't work anymore. Feed is cached by its url: /mnt/sdcard/Android/data/de.danoeh.antennapod/files/cache/feed-httpwww.ivoox.comfeed_fg_f19701_filtro_1.xml But then it seems to be trying to access it by its name: W/System.err(22100): java.io.FileNotFoundException: /mnt/sdcard/Android/data/de.danoeh.antennapod/files/cache/feed-Documentales Sonoros (Invalid argument) This is Play Store version 0.9.7.1.

report.summary: Delay before playing an episode
report.label: bug
report.description: Before playing each episode for the first time there's a delay of a few seconds. During it looks like there is network traffic. If coverage is bad it can take more than 20 seconds before start playing.

report.summary: Automatic Download option does not work.
report.label: bug
report.description: I have this selected in Settings but it does not ever automatically download anything. Also when adding a podcast to the list, it should mark the last podcast as "new" and download it, so it will start with something in the list.

report.summary: Lockscreen widget flickering
report.label: bug
report.description: Hi, I'm using a Galaxy Nexus with Android 4.2.2, and the lockscreen widget has this strange behaviour. When I pause with the screen locked, the widget becomes large and starts to flicker. The two attached images show the problem: If the widget is already large, it flicks anyway. When I try to slide left or right to see another widget or camera, the camera preview and the other widget start to flickr also. I don't know exactly if this problem is in your code, but the Google Play Music doesn't change at all on any interaction.

report.summary: Moving podcast in organise queue moves different podcast
report.label: bug
report.description: Moving a podcast up the queue either does nothing or moves a completely different podcast from elsewhere in the queue up. Possibly something to do with large (79) number of items in queue.

report.summary: Image handling in show notes
report.label: bug
report.description: Very large images in show notes are shown at full resolution and extend out of view. A good example of this is in the show notes for the most recent episode of Star Talk Radio titled "Space Chronicles (Part 2)". Here is the RSS feed: http://www.startalkradio.net/feed/shows/ The image file http://www.startalkradio.net/wp-content/uploads/2013/05/Aki_Hoshide_takesself-portrait_outside_ISS_964x640.jpg is the image that is too wide for the screen on my Nexus 4. Here is a screenshot of this image displayed on my Nexus 4 running version 0.9.7.3 of AntennaPods:

report.summary: ANR on resuming
report.label: bug
report.description: as seen in the screenshot the resuming of a podcast is done on the main thread. this also causes the app to crash if you send the app to background.

report.summary: Antennapod always crashes at startup after playing corrupt m4a file once
report.label: bug
report.description: I tried to play a .m4a file from the file manager using antennapod as the audio player, which did not work. It turned out that the .m4a file was corrupt, the download stopped at 95%. Now antennapod always crashes right after starting the program. I removed the corrupt file, I also put the valid file at the same location as the corrupt file, still no chance. Deleting antennapod and all data helps, but I lose all my subscriptions and progress info. When I restore from a backup (done right before deleting antennapod to fix the problem) I see in the background that all subscriptions are there, but then the program crashes :-( I sent a bug report using the built-in crash handler, maybe you have received it? Regards, and thanks for this beautiful app! Thomas

report.summary: Moving the time index circle or pressing skip forward at the end of an episode crashes AntennaPod.
report.label: bug
report.description: Play an episode Skip almost to the end, when there's a few seconds left. Continuously press the forward button. If tapped 3-4 times AntennaPod crashes. Alternatively. Play an episode Skip almost to the end, when there's a few seconds left. When the time index circle has reached the end of the episode, pull it back and it will occasionally crash.

report.summary: Crash + wiped all settings/etc.
report.label: bug
report.description: Yesterday evening AntennaPod crashed during a manual feed update and when I went back in everything was gone! "You haven't subscribed to any feeds yet". Opening a file manager, I see that Android/data/de.danoeh.antennapod/ still looks good (so I made a copy of it!). The files/media/ directories still contain podcasts that I have downloaded, and the files/cache/ directories still contain all the feed-* files. Is there a way in which I can get AntennaPod to recreate the settings, etc, or should I just go ahead and add everything back in manually? Where are the settings files stored that tell AntennaPod what I'm subscribed to, etc? I have Update interval set to Manual, and I manually update feeds several times a day. Every couple of days or so, the app crashes during an update, usually if I try to do other operations within the app at the same time. I just go back in and retry and all is fine. Thanks! -Ross

report.summary: Deleted feed is recreated after update
report.label: bug
report.description: After deleting a feed, I updated manually the feeds. During the update stage the deleted feed was recreated. I am using the variable speed test version.

report.summary: AntennaPod forgets about already downloaded podcast episodes
report.label: bug
report.description: AntennaPod "forgets" the already downloaded files within a very short time no matter if the episodes are downloaded manually or by the automatic download function (which is working for me btw). What happens: Download progress is looking good. After successful downloading there is an indication (arrow down) the files are stored locally and I can play them offline. Fine. But after closing and restarting the app most of the time (not always) the little indication is gone and AntennaPod is offering the download option again. That's wrong. It's more annoying if one is using the automatic download function. The podcast episodes are downloaded over and over again until the sd-card is full(?). After 60 minutes I had a lot of files like xxxxx-1.mp3 xxxxxx-2.mp3 xxxxxx-3.mp3 and so on... What am I using: AntennaPod 0.9.7.4 (from F-Droid repo) Android 4.2.2 Cyanogenmod 10.1.2 Path to podcasts: /storage/sdcard0/Podcasts/... Best regards, AlfredSK

report.summary: Force close when downloading an episode
report.label: bug
report.description: Whenever I ask AntennaPod to download an episode, it force closes. The crashes used to only happen when downloading everything in my queue, but now it crashes even when I request an individual episode to be downloaded. If I increase the number of episodes allowed in my cache, I can then download specific episodes for a few days and then it starts force closing again. I suspect this is caused by two inter-related issues. When the episode cache is full, it force closes instead of cancelling the download and providing some intelligent message to the user It appears not clean up download episodes after listening to them. I recently cleared dozens of old episodes out of my media folder that were not deleted when I completed listening to them. I suspect that some counter was not cleared when I deleted the files, so the application still thinks I'm at my limit of cached episodes. AntennaPod 0.9.7.4 Nexus 4, Build JWR66V

report.summary: Iframes are open separately
report.label: bug
report.description: Feed Items which contain an Iframe are open in an external browser. They should probably be opened inline. The thing is that shouldOverrideUrlLoading() is called for iframes while loading the page, and not only when user clicks on a link. I am not sure about the workaround, but i think we should use a condition in handling of shouldOverrideUrlLoading(): While page is loading assume url is an iframe and load internally (return false). After page finished loading use current behaviour, load externally (do the intent and return true).

report.summary: Sort mecanism broken
report.label: bug
report.description: Hello, Since yesterday, I can not sort episodes anymore. It used to work fine. Now, when trying to move an episode up or down: after following my finger, when I drop it where I wan it, the complete list flickers, then it goes back to its initial position. I am using AntennaPod 0.9.7.4 on Android 4.1.2 since a few months. What can I do, except uninstall / reinstall (and lose all my history) ? Could it be a missing right on a file somewhere, lost for an unknown reason? Thanks for your help.

report.summary: Variable speed not working in 0.9.7.5
report.label: bug
report.description: When I install the Prestissimo package playing breaks. When I try to play it will do nothing. All I get in logcat is this: 09-11 19:28:24.052 D/AocateServiceBackedMediaPlayer( 7096): getDuration() 311 09-11 19:28:24.068 D/AocateServiceBackedMediaPlayer( 7096): getDuration() 311 09-11 19:28:25.021 D/AocateServiceBackedMediaPlayer( 7096): getDuration() 311 09-11 19:28:25.060 D/AocateServiceBackedMediaPlayer( 7096): getDuration() 311

report.label: bug
report.description: Running Google TV 3.2 Logitech Revue, app crashes when settings menu is selected. AntennaPod 0.9.7.5

report.summary: Google TV AntennaPod issue - Video no longer plays in full screen
report.label: bug
report.description: In Google TV 3.2 Logitech Revue on a 1080p TV, using AntennaPod 16:9 video has a significant black border on the bottom, left and right edges. The previous version properly scaled the video to full screen without any borders. I don't know if its not scaling the 16:9 720p source video is not scaling enough. I think it might be scaling it but just not to maximum resolution of the display. AntennaPod 0.9.7.5

report.summary: Google TV AnntenaPod issue - Pause key on the Google TV remote does not pause playback
report.label: bug
report.description: In Google TV 3.2 Logitech Revue, pressing the pause button on the device's remote does not pause the video. When the pause button is pressed on the device's remote, the video appears to re-buffer and then continues to play. (Pressing skip forward and skip back buttons on the remote do work properly however :D ) Pressing pause via the app's UI with a mouse press does properly pause the video's playback. AntennaPod 0.9.7.5

report.summary: Most bitmaps/icons not showing
report.label: bug
report.description: Recently icons stopped loading, both in podcast and episodes tab. I get this in logcat: 09-17 10:02:31.398 W/BitmapDecodeWorkerTask( 7056): Could not load bitmap. Using default image. 09-17 10:02:31.452 W/BitmapDecodeWorkerTask( 7056): Could not load bitmap. Using default image. 09-17 10:02:31.476 W/BitmapDecodeWorkerTask( 7056): Could not load bitmap. Using default image. Not sure since when this is happening.

report.summary: Most Recent Episode incorrect following podcast with no episodes
report.label: bug
report.description: v0.9.7.5 In the podcast list screen, when there is a podcast with no episodes, it is displayed as "Most Recent Episode" of the next podcast in the list. The subsequent "Most Recent Episode" timestamps are are also incorrect, each being shuffled up i.e. podcast number 3 has the timestamp from podcast 4, podcast 4 has the timestamp from podcast 5 and so on. Device: Samsung Galaxy Ace 2 GT-I18160 Android 4.1.2

report.summary: Regression in 0.9.7.5: "Settings" menu does not update itself for changes in submenus.
report.label: bug
report.description: Setting the number in "Episode cache" does not update until Setting menu gets closed and opened again. In 0.9.7.4 it worked as expected. Similar behaviour can be observed also within "Automatic download": Setting the tick at "Automatic download" does not enable "Enable Wi-Fi filter". To get "Enable Wi-Fi filter accessible you need to exit from the "Settings" menu completely and choose "Settings/Automatic download" again.

report.summary: Bug: reading autostart on unlocking
report.label: bug
report.description: When the headphone are disconnected, AP stops playing. That's fine. However, as one has to unlock the phone to do anything with it, then AP restarts playing. This is a recent behavior, and should not happen, at least for this use case: using the headphone removal to stop playing, then moving on to something else. If it is not a bug but a recent feature, could it be optionnal? Thanks.

report.summary: Version 0.9.7.5 does not show play button, does not play (F-Droid build)
report.label: bug
report.description: The latest version does not show a play button for all my mp3 files and I can not play any. Downgrading to 0.9.7.4 also does not work since then the app force closes right after each start. This is an F-Droid build. F-Droid is building releases according to https://github.com/danieloeh/AntennaPod/wiki/Building-AntennaPod

report.summary: prioritise episode details
report.label: bug
report.description: Since v0.7.5 (Google Play store build), I have the impression that episode details aren't viewable anymore, if downloads are running in parallel. The display stays blank for many seconds often, and sometimes the app also crashes (although that might be related to me running CM 10.2 nightlies). When no downloads are running, the episode details are displayes as quickly as expected. It would be great if downloading episode details could be prioritised over other downloads. Thanks and greetings!

report.summary: Pause button delays for minutes
report.label: bug
report.description: If I play pause button on my headphones when just connected to a wifi network it will actually pause or play several seconds to minutes later. This only happens when just connected to a wifi network. If I have been connected for a while it will work normally. I can easily reproduce the problem by start playing, disabling and enabling wifi and let it connect, then pause on headphones. Tested on 0.9.7.5 as well as develop versions. Android 4.2.2 (CM10.1 Unofficial). Samsung GT-i9003

report.summary: Video aspect ratio wrong
report.label: bug
report.description: When I play videos from this podcast, the aspect ratio is wrong: http://mediacenter.dw.de/english/podcasts/ Compare it to playback via the build in video player or VLC for Android.

report.summary: Auto downloading doesn't download new podcasts immediately but waits for the next interval
report.label: bug
report.description: When the automatic download updates the feeds and a new episode is found, that episode is not downloaded immediately. Instead AntennaPod will wait for your custom set update interval (2h in my case). Leaving the house with an undownloaded episode is a bit annoying, easpecially when the download would have only taken a few seconds on your wifi. I did not test if that issue appears when setting a high update interval, but if it does one would receive all new episodes only after a high delay. My personal fix is to regularly check for new podcasts and hitting the update button manully, but I would like AntennaPod to be purely push- and not pull-style.

report.summary: Sudden stops and wrong resume time.
report.label: bug
report.description: Many times when i want to resume playback it will resume at earlier location than when i left it. Other times it will stop after a minute of playback. When I try to play again it will start from a very old time of that chapter.

report.summary: Last played: sort order
report.label: bug
report.description: IMHO it would make more sense if the last played episode would come first. Short: reverse order

report.summary: Media content not shown and not loaded, when added to existing rss item
report.label: bug
report.description: Example of rss feed: http://news.tut.by/rss/s~1185.rss. Updated weekly. Initially, items in feed are populated without media content. This is an announcement. AntennaPod shows this item with no media content attached. After one - two days there media content was added. AntennaPod shows that no media content was attached to this rss item after updating feed.

report.summary: Playback finishes early on Android 4.4.2
report.label: bug
report.description: When listening to downloaded audio podcasts with the screen off on Android 4.4.2 the playback stops before the end of the file. For example, on one of the MP3s from http://downloads.bbc.co.uk/podcasts/radio4/thpop/rss.xml it stops around 15 seconds from the end when the device is locked, but continues to the end if the screen is on. I've seen this on a Nexus 5 using version 0.9.8.0 from the Play store, and on an generic emulated device with the current master, develop and playbackservice_rewrite branches. An emulated Android 4.2.2 image doesn't have any trouble.

report.summary: Problem with derTag Podcast - 0 byte files vanish
report.label: bug

I can download manually and listen to every episode. Every time the feed updates the first entry vanishes (even when downloaded) until everything is gone. Recent version (0.9.8.0) from play store on Android 4.1.1

report.summary: Case-insensitive ordering of podcast feed list
report.label: bug
report.description: The order of the list of podcast feeds seems to be ordered in ASCII order, i.e. it is case-sensitive. Thus, the position of a podcast named abcdef is after that of ZYXWVU, which seems counter-intuitive to me. It would be better if the order would be case-insensitive, i.e. AABB -> abcdef -> ZYWWVU.

As soon as I try to make an update, new entries are not added, intead the latest entry is removed. So if I 2 times try to make an update, the first 2 entries are removed. Seems to be a bug of Antennapod. Please fix this issue. thanks chris412

It looks like the file is still playing. I can't get it to stop or allow me to delete the file. I can delete the app's data but that's a tad extreme. report.summary: Make it possible to remove last podcast of playlist
report.label: bug

Even if skipping this episode (effectively completely clearing the playlist), it still can't be removed from within its feed overview. The only options offered are to skip the epidosde (which doesn't make any sense) and to add it to the playlist again.

report.summary: The AC360 podcast shows 0 bytes episodes
report.label: bug
report.description: The AC360 podcast show 0 bytes episodes that can't be downloaded. Feed works and has full downloadable episodes in other players. Feed: http://www.cnn.com/services/podcasting?eref=ac360audio

report.summary: None of the CNN podcast feeds work.
report.label: bug
report.description: None of the CNN podcast feeds work with AntennaPod. They get added but when checking episodes all of them show with "Size 0 B" but with correct publication time. The episodes can not be downloaded but can be streamed. These feeds work fine in other players like Podkicker and PodcastAddict. A couple of examples: AC360: http://rss.cnn.com/services/podcasting/ac360audio/rss Erin Burnett Out Front: http://rss.cnn.com/services/podcasting/eboutfront/rss I'm running 0.9.8.2 on Android 4.2.2

report.summary: Playback and queue corrupts when an episode that was played outside of the queue finishes.
report.label: bug
report.description: I'm working off the develop branch, fetched two hours ago. Normally I wouldn't write a bug report about the develop branch, but considering you merged it to the master branch 6 hours ago, I think it's fine. To reproduce this Have an empty queue Go the podcasts tab and play something directly from the list (so without adding anything to the queue). Finish the episode (doesn't matter how: skip, slide, listen) Repeat 2, but make sure it's the same episode 4a. Notice that you can't play the episode. 4b. Notice that the episode is now in the queue, but can't play it from there either 4c. Remove and repeat 4 will result in the same situation. How to get out of this situation (sometimes) Play a different episode Finish the episode (doesn't matter how: skip, slide, listen) The app should skip to the next episode Sometimes you can play this, sometimes you can't, but when you can and the episode finishes, things will go back to normal.

report.summary: Icon for some downloaded episodes disappears when completed (in nightly)
report.label: bug
report.description: In the latest nightly build (antennapod-develop-05b2295-nightly) some of the icons for episodes downloaded and added to queue disappears as soon as the download is complete so that there's just a blank field when the icon should have been.

report.summary: App exits after changing theme
report.label: bug
report.description: If I go to Settings and change the theme, then click the back button or the settings icon, the app closes. It doesn't show a Force Close or any error, just returns to the home screen. Tested with 0.9.8.3 on Android 4.4 (CM11)

report.summary: Play via widget after reboot
report.label: bug
report.description: Hey! After a reboot, hitting play via widget has no effect, even when a playlist exists. I have to trigger play from within the app. There should be played from the last played position.

Look here: video rss feed: http://www.cczwei.de/rss_tvissues.php audio rss feed: http://www.cczwei.de/rss_issues.php I can't add both of these rss feeds at the same time - only one of them, because when trying this, Antennapod states that I've already subscribed to it! Please fix this annoying issue. Thanks! Regards, Mister Floppy

If I try adding the connection to Flattr, I get towards the dialogue to enter my credentials, submit and afterwards receive a 404 popup. report.label: bug

Wait Observed behaviour Info from Top podcasts - Error occured:java.net.ssl.SSLPeerUnverifiedException: No peer certificate Expected: Podcast list is populated with podcasts Same error occur when searching from top magnificator.

report.summary: This feed only works one time, after being added
report.label: bug
report.description: The feed http://www.radioradicale.it/podcasting.php?e=74 only works just after being added to antennapod. When I try to update it, it doesn't download new episodes; the only way to get new episodes is by removing the feed and re-adding it. Of course if you can spot the problem in the feed, I will be happy to forward the problem to the original author so that it can be fixed.

report.summary: New UI: "Downloading podcast data" in notification area
report.label: bug
report.description: Since the latest update with the new UI I can't delete Antennapod from the notification area. "Downloading podcast data" with the syncing logo always stays in the notification area without any option/possibility to remove it from there After the sync process it should be possible to remove the entry from the notification area

report.summary: Continuous playback of videos not working (have to press "PLAY" manually)
report.label: bug
report.description: Hi, I checked the option "Continuous playback", and it's working fine with audio files. However, for videos after finishing one item, the player only selects the next one in the list, but doesn't start it automatically, so you have to press "PLAY" manually. Please fix this very annoying issue, when taking a bath in the tub, I don't want to get my tablet wet :-) Thanks!

report.summary: Missing "Mark as read" for individual items without media attachment in "All Episodes" view
report.label: bug
report.description: A minor usability annoyance: When a podcast has an intermittent article in the feed that doesn't have a media attachment, the only way to get it out of the "All Episodes" view is through the "Mark all as read" item on the list. Only those entries with media enclosures have the individual "Mark as read" items. Unless I've been missing the obvious - in that case I'm suggesting to make it better visible, e.g. in the same place (article details) where you can find it for articles with media enclosures.

report.summary: Queue count doesn't update when a podcast is removed
report.label: bug

report.summary: Antennapod crashes on opening settings
report.label: bug
report.description: Fresh google play install on Xiaomi MI 3W MIUI-4.6.27 crashes when pressing the settings menu item.

report.summary: Broken episode entries when having 2 podcasts with the same title (case insensitive)
report.label: bug
report.description: I recently added a podcast which happened to have the same title as one of the podcasts I already had, except for one letter that was lowercase in one title and uppercase in the other title. Here they are: http://www.rtl.fr/podcast/la-revue-de-presse.xml (title: "La revue de Presse") http://cdn-new-europe1.ladmedia.fr/var/exports/podcasts/sound/revue-de-presse.xml (title: "La revue de presse") After refreshing my episode list, I got broken entries, as if AntennaPod mixed the 2 podcasts somehow (title from one of the podcast, with photo from the other podcast for instance). Since podcast infos are kept in files named after the podcast titles on my FAT32 formatted memory card (case insensitive filesystem), my best guess is that when refreshing the whole episode list, the files from one of the podcasts overwrite the files from the other podcast.

report.summary: Crash at end of downloads

My next post contains a logcat. It looks like it might be an unhandled exception upon failure to connect to Google Analytics.

report.summary: Unable to interpret correct dates on a podcast
report.label: bug
report.description: Hi There I have been trying to add a certain podcast feed to antennaPod list. It is the podcast for "Richard Herring's Leicester Square Theatre Podcast". Every time I add the feed it thinks every podcast is today. The next day when I updated the feed it increments the day and shows every podcast as today. I've had the feed in the app for a week and it does the same thing every day. The issue looks very similar to an issue reported before, #178, which was marked as won't fix because the was a legal issue with that feeds contents. The feed in this case is sourced via a feedburner link, I would have assumed there would have been some legal checks performed on it. I have check the pubDate values and they are all different dates. However I did notice that the timezone region is listed as GMT, not something like +0000.

report.summary: Playback speed controls missing since latest update 0.9.9.5
report.label: bug
report.description: Two days ago I updated my phone (Nexus 5) to Android 5.0/Lollipop. Antennapod works like before. But yesterday there was a new Antennapod update (0.9.9.5) and now the playback speed controls are missing. I'm able to set the playback speeds in the setting menu, but I can't speed up the playback in the podcast view when listening to an podcast. I tried to uninstall und reinstall Prestissimo, but this doesn't help.

report.summary: Queue doesn't work since update
report.label: bug
report.description: Since I loaded the latest update yesterday, the podcast queue no longer works. It will not always continue to the next podcast, or maybe it simply stops playing after a period of time. I need a podcast player that will always play the next podcast in the queue indefinitely.

report.summary: Can't switch to a different podcast while one is playing in v0.9.9.5
report.label: bug
report.description: If i have a podcast playing currently I can't go find another one and play that one instead. This previously worked in other versions. When i click on a different podcasts play button it goes to the playing screen but has the podcast I was listening to stopped but set as the active podcast. This is occurring v0.9.9.5 on the Lollipop operation system, Nexus 5 phone. Restarting, clearing the chase or rebooting didn't make a difference either. (same as sthesing)

report.summary: No fullscreen video in android 5.0
report.label: bug
report.description: There is a narrow edge around the video. No fullscreen anymore with nexus 5

report.summary: Hitting 'menu' button force closes in 0.9.9.5
report.label: bug
report.description: At least in JellyBean (4.1.2). Sent several reports. Without menu button, unable to access settings. Previous version was fine. The fact nobody other has open a bug for this makes me suspect that it does not happen in KitKat or Lollipod? It produces a java.lang.NullPointerException in class com.android.internal.policy.impl.PhoneWindow method oneKeyUpPanel line number 1002. Observed similar behaviour in some other apps after adapted to lollipop (not sure if it's related, but suspicious).

report.summary: Automatic feed updates not working
report.label: bug
report.description: Automatic feed updates not working. I was wait some days, restarted phone - nothing helps. Only manual update works (top right button). My settings: Mobile network updates disabled. Wifi updates enabled. Wifi filter disabled. Update interval 1 hour. AntennaPod 0.9.9.5 Android 4.1.1 (Prestigio Multiphone 4055 DUO)

report.summary: AntennaPod fails on protocol relative urls
report.label: bug
report.description: On protocol relative url AntennaPod prepends http:// which leads to an unusable url of form http:////example.com

report.summary: IOError: ENAMETOOLONG when downloading episode with long title
report.label: bug
report.description: Apparently AntennaPod stores audio files using the episode title as the filename (as opposed to using the original filename from the URL). If the episode title is too long then it is not possible to download the episode due to a filesystem limitation -- it can still be streamed though. The typical limit for a filename on common filesystems is 255 bytes.

report.summary: Password protected pods fail to load
report.label: bug
report.description: I've subscribed to the ZEIT Premium Podcast (URL: https://premium.zeit.de/itunes/feed) which is only available with a valid user name and password. Everything worked fine on v0.9.9.4, however, now on v1.0 I'm always prompted to reenter my credentials when I want to download a new entry although previously saved. However, reentering the login information does nothing so that the download fails in general. I've already triple-checked by password. Furthermore, I deleted and reinstalled the pod, without any changes. Ideas? ‚Äî running on CM11 M9, Android 4.4.4

report.summary: Playback turns choppy in a few minutes intervals.
report.label: bug
report.description: When I play back podcasts there's a little choppy part occurring every 3-6 minutes. It sounds like a a slightly damaged mp3 or what happens when the buffer is empty during streaming. However, since it occurs on downloaded epsodes it's not buffering.

report.summary: When playing, pause doesn't work in the lists
report.label: bug
report.description: In either the All Episodes or Queue, it is possible to play the episode using the play button at the right of the item. This button changes into a pause button as expected; however, it doesn't function as one. If tapped upon, it goes into the media view without pausing. Note: it is possible to pause using other methods, but the button in the list view never changes between play and pause after it has changed to pause.

report.summary: Autodownload based on charging isn't working in the 1.1rc1 release.
report.label: bug
report.description: It had been implemented using the method outlined here: http://developer.android.com/training/monitoring-device-state/battery-monitoring.html However, that method isn't working anymore. In the logs we see that the call to intent.getIntExtra(BatteryManager.EXTRA_STATUS, -1) is returning -1. It isn't clear why this happened. We could resolve it by creating two different power connection listeners, ones that just handled connected/disconnected. I'd be interested in figuring out why this happened however. What changed? Continuing to look at it.

report.summary: PlaybackTests currently failing
report.label: bug
report.description: Specifically PlaybackTests. startLocalPlaybackFromQueue and PlaybackTests. startLocalPlayback are failing. They're failing because they expect the AudioplayerActivity to show up after you click on 'Play' from within 'New Episodes' and 'Queue'. That isn't happening anymore. I don't know when this change was introduced, if it was intentional or inadvertent (if I had to guess I'd say it was #693). I think that, before we make any change, we should figure out what the behavior should be. Do we want the audio player activity to start when you click on 'play' on an item in the list? I'm not sure that makes sense. Any opinions?

report.summary: Issues Reported from Google Groups "Please(!) bring back the "all episodes" list"
report.label: bug
report.description:
I had a discussion with someone on the Google Group for AntennaPod. I'm not quite sure why they're experiencing the issues they're seeing. If it's something to do with the device they're using or if this is a usability issue or some combination of the two. He seems frustrated enough that we should probably consider what is going on and think about how it could be addressed. I'm following up with the author to find out what device they're using. Tim: Sad enough that you had to switch from the play list to "all episodes" every time you launch the app for a few months now, the "all episodes" lists is now missing completely. If I want to listen to an episode now, I have to search 3 lists to find it. This makes this great app almost unusable. Additionally, you have to scroll very, very carefully now not to swype one of the episodes out of the list. Please bring back the "all episodes" list or at least have a switch in the settings to turn it on. I was so glad I found a good podcast app, finally, I don't want to move all my podcasts again. Me: Hi Tim,
The All Episodes list is still around, it's just called 'New Episodes'. 'New Episodes' defaults to showing only those episodes that haven't been added to the queue. However, you can click the little three dots and clear the option that says to show new episodes only.
I wonder if you're using the app in a way that is somehow different from how most other people are using it. Most people add episodes to the queue and listen to them from there. You can configure the app to do this for you automatically if you like. Tim Thanks for your answer. I tried to use the app the way you proposed now and add the episodes I want to listen to to the playlist, but this release seems to be extremely buggy. E.g. - Some of my podcasts were in the playlist, some are not, I could not figure out what rule is behind this. So I decided to start from scracht und delete the episodes in the playlist to start with an empty one and add the episodes I plan to listen to. A few seconds after I emptied the list, more and more seemingly random episodes appeared in the list again. If I swype episodes away from the playlist, these exact same episode appear again in the list (happened 4 times with one episode) after a few seconds or minutes. The list is constantly filled up with random episodes - and the app seems to start downloading these random episodes after adding them to the list. - If "swyping away" multiple episodes in a row, the app reproducibly crases - Some of my podcasts are automatically downloaded, some are not, even though I have "automatic download" enabled for all podcasts (but this problem also existed in previous releases) - If I download podcasts manually in the "new eposodes" list, they are not marked as downloaded after the download (at least in 90% of the cases) - so I don't know which one I already downloaded - As already said, swyping is much more sensive than in any other app, which always makes you swype episodes away when scolling. Undoing the operation does not bring back the episode, at least not until changing to another list and then opening the first list again. - Loading the list sometimes takes minutes - or maybe the process hangs somehow. I never experienced that with the previous releases.
Maybe going back to the last stable release and fixing the bugs beforde publishing the new release would be a good idea. I really appreciate the work you do for a good, free opensource app, but on my part I cannot really use the app in this condition. Me: Hmm. We honestly haven't had those problems (crashes, random downloads, etc...) and have received mostly positive feedback regarding this release.
However, I'm certainly concerned. I'll be sure to relay these concerns to the rest of the team and we'll see what we can do.

report.summary: Major missed use case: Managing everything from 'All Episodes'
report.label: bug
report.description: I think we missed a major use case of 'All Episodes' From a recent play store review: All episodes listing removed No clue why it was removed, now I have to look at a list with barely visible episodes. The old listing was far better. Showed episodes and clearly showed what was new. Silly change for the sake of change. Nothing beneficial. The user from #741 also seemed to care quite a bit about 'All Episodes'. I think some users (not sure how many) weren't actually using the queue. They were just using All Episodes and playing things as they wished. Our changes disrupted their workflow significantly. We didn't notice this because we all play everything from the queue and thought of 'All Episodes' as a place to go simply to add things to the Queue. I'd like to suggest the following changes for a 1.1.1 release (based on the version_1.1 branch): Instead of defaulting to the Queue view, we should really just display the last fragment the user was looking at when the app closed We should probably decrease or remove the amount of fading that happens to 'read' episodes in the 'New Episodes' list We should see if there are any low risk ways to implement some of @heckler01's suggestions from #721 (if there's no easy way it can wait for a more major update) Thoughts?

report.summary: Stopping downloads does not work
report.label: bug
report.description: Enable autodownload. Refresh so that a number of new episodes is found. Open the "Downloads" view. Choose any new episode and click the "x" on the right to stop the download. Each time a download of another item has finished, the episode where the download is stopped will be marked to be downloaded again.

report.summary: 'Search' displays in toolbar as word and not icon
report.label: bug
report.description: When the search button is displayed in the toolbar it is sometimes displayed as the word 'search' instead of the search icon (the magnifying glass). This happened on 2.3.7 in the New Episodes view when that view was empty (no new episodes). May occur at other times.

report.summary: Minor UI issue: "1 Downloads Left"
report.label: bug
report.description: I noticed when there is 1 download remaining, the notification still says "1 Downloads Left". Not "1 Download Left". Not a big deal, but thought I would point it out in case nobody had noticed it yet. Love the application! I'm using a Nexus 4 with Android 5.1 in English, but it looks like this is language and version-independent.

report.summary: OPML Import not working with Podcast Addict backup
report.label: bug
report.description: When I attempt to import the file linked below the app appears to do nothing with Options 1 and 2 on the import screen. I also attempted sharing the file to AntennaPod and got a message box containing "An error occured:Parser Exception()" https://gist.github.com/CWftw/bf6e36e28360762db5b6

report.summary: Deadlock during playback in 1.2 alpha
report.label: bug
report.description: I ran in to a deadlock issue when testing 1.2 build 53 on my HTC One M7 running 5.0.2. It started when playback was getting interrupted by navigation. Some of the interruptions worked and then eventually playback just never resumed. Eventually I hooked it up to adb logcat and was able to see it generate the traces.txt file. The entire time it was locked it was printing lots of these messages: 05-23 16:38:10.624: D/PlayerWidgetService(1653): Service was called while updating. Ignoring update request I think this may be due to this change where the tryLock() was changed to a lock(). Here is a dump of the thread traces

report.summary: End of clip cut off when playing at >1x speed
report.label: bug
report.description: When listening at higher speed than 1x, tail of the clip is being cut off. It's always a small amount of time -- but at a high speed, it's not negligible. Example clip: http://www.npr.org/2015/05/26/409673364/artist-makes-money-off-other-peoples-instagram-photos 1x cuts off the last word 2.3x cuts off last 2 sentences Notes: I listen to podcasts at up to 2.3x speed

report.summary: Clips often fail to play when using BT headset
report.label: bug
report.description: Currently playing clips are usually OK, but if the next one comes up -- the app frequently stops playing (and often can't start back up) until the BT headset is disconnected. When disconnected, next clip can be played and if BT headset is connected while playing, everything is fine. Notes: Does not stop on every clip transition. Some clips refuse to start playing via BT headset almost 100% of the time (different podcast/filetype??) I usually listen at up to 2.3x speed, but switching down to 1.0 doesn't seem to help much. Possibly unrelated: sometimes "Prestissimo has stopped" error pops up, then the clip starts playing at 1.0x speed (and speed controls become unavailable until playback is paused)

report.description: This was reported in the play store against an Alpha version of 1.2. OS was Android 5.0. report.summary: Menu navigation Queue button doesn't always open Queue
report.label: bug
report.description: In the side menu, there are buttons for the Queue, all the individual podcast subscriptions and the settings, among other things. Through some voodoo witchcraft navigation, it is possible to be in the window of a subscription, and when clicking on the Queue button, not going to the Queue instead staying in that subscription. I don't have a consistent way of arriving at this yet, but these are the approximate steps: Start at Queue Go to a subscription's page ???. Navigate to some pages that have back arrows in the top left Also, use the android back button not the app's one At some point, use the home screen to go to the android home page, and relaunch the app using the app icon Through some combination of the ??? above, you end up at the subscription's page but clicking the Queue button won't take you to the Queue, leaving you stuck at the subscription's page until you go to New Episodes or something like that

report.summary: Podcast icon in playback view really small
report.label: bug
report.description: In previous versions, the podcast icon seemed to always be scaled up to the full width of the phone when in 'playback view' (where you only really see the podcast you're playing and have all the playback controls). Now, some podcasts have really small icons in the middle, which I suppose means they aren't high-res enough to fill the entire screen. If this was a deliberate choice so be it, but I preferred it the old way so here's hoping it's accidental :)

report.summary: Podcast URL in info window partially off screen
report.label: bug
report.description: When you go to a podcast subscription from the navigation drawer, and tap the little 'i' thing you get a page with information about the subscription. Among other things, it has the URL of the feed. This URL if longer than the width of the area for it, won't continue on the next line and instead just disappear off screen.

report.summary: Misbehaviour at end of playback when next in Queue is undownloaded
report.label: bug
report.description: If you play a podcast in the Queue and the next item in the Queue is not downloaded, when the playback ends the playback controls view doesn't go away if it was open, instead just showing playback controls that don't do anything and no cover. Furthermore, the bottom Now Playing/Play-pause bar shows the episode that just finished with the pause button. How to replicate: Put downloaded podcast in Queue Put not downloaded podcast in Queue right below the previous one Play first podcast Go to playback controls and drag playback timer to end of file Playback controls are blank (problem part 1) Go back to Queue Bottom bar shows just finished podcast (problem part 2)

report.summary: Unable to interpret correct dates on a podcast #3
report.label: bug
report.description: The most recent release of AntennaPod seems to have a bug that has been fixed. Last December I reported incorrect dates on a podcast in issue #545, this was fixed correctly when the issue was closed. With the newest release I am seen the exact same failure mode as was reported in that issue. From that issue: It is the podcast for "Richard Herring's Leicester Square Theatre Podcast". Every time I add the feed it thinks every podcast is today. The next day when I updated the feed it increments the day and shows every podcast as today.

report.summary: Episode necromancy
report.label: bug
report.description: AP keeps resurrecting (downloading and adding to the queue) episodes I have listened to. The resurrected episodes get added as new ones come out in the same feed. At one point the queue was completely empty, the next day I had the new episodes released that day, plus the previous one for each of those feeds. I have auto refresh on every 4th hour, along with autodowload/queue. When long-pressing on the episodes I have the option to mark them as unplayed, so I'm assuming AP remembers I've listened to them, or marked them as played/skipped (difference?) before. Marking then as unplayed gives me the option to play them. All the files exist on the device and I can play them immediately and I don't have the option to stream them. When I notice this, I have to go into each episode, tap to remove the file, wait for the file to be removed, tap to remove it from the queue, back out, wait a while until the episode disappears from the queue (takes several seconds, if it even works), and hope they don't come back again. Sorting the queue while doing this can get really interesting as it randomly ressurrects episodes I just removed too. I have a Samsung S3 GT-I9300 with Cyanogenmod 12.1 and I'm currently in the alpha/beta program.

report.summary: Feed picture not displayed
report.label: bug
report.description: Feed address: http://trip.since1989.org/feed/podcast/ AntennaPod:1.2.1

report.summary: Rewind / Fast forward settings aren't remembered after the first launch
report.label: bug
report.description: Using Lollipop (5.1.1) on a Nexus 4. I encounter the following issue: When I change the time settings for rewind and/or forward, the settings aren't saved. If I use another app or even go into another part of AntennaPod and go back the buttons are back to the default setting (30s).

report.summary: Feed is slow to update
report.label: bug
report.description: Updated from 1.1.1 to 1.2.1 and feeds take ages (minutes or not at all) to update. Logcat is spammed with 'timezone name loaded for en_US in 347Ms ' or similar. I'm using CM7.2 without Gapps and not that locale.

report.summary: Apod crashes when start playing a pcast on Huawei P8 lite
report.label: bug
report.description: AntennaPod crashes shortly (less than a second) after starting to play a downloaded file or a stream. I tried various Podcasts with the same result. Please inform me if you need more informations. Phone: Huawei P8 lite Android 5.0 EMUI 3.1 Log: https://gist.github.com/kentrockman/54c81566727b3a6595d2

report.summary: IndexOutOfBoundsException in RunningDownloadsFragment
report.label: bug
report.description: I believe this is caused by a race condition. The item is removed from the list before getItem is called. We could solve this by just checking the index in getItem before returning, but that could still cause a race condition. Better would be to see if we should be operating on a copy of the list, synchronizing access to it somehow, or using a better method of identifying downloads. java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException: report.label: bug

report.summary: NullPointerException in PlaybackController when media is null

report.summary: "No external storage is available" on Cyanogenmod 12 / Lollipop (LG Optimus G)
report.label: bug
report.description: The course of events is somewhat complicated, so here is everything in chronological order: My phone is an LG Optimus G (e975), running Cyanogenmod. This device has no sd card slot, external storage is emulated at /storage/emulated/0. It was running Cyanogenmod 11 (Android 4.4 iirc) and AntennaPod 1.1.2. I didn't encounter any of the issues below then. As CM 12 became available I upgraded to that version, upgrading the Google Apps in the process. Soon later I noticed AntennaPod wasn't updating feeds properly, a new episode wasn't shown even after manual refresh, though it was clearly in the feed. Using paged feeds also didn't work, the "v" button was shown, but pressing it yielded no results after loading was done. I noticed AntennaPod's version on F-Droid (1.1.2) was outdated, so I reinstalled 1.2 from Google Play. Starting AntennaPod results in the error: No external storage is available . Please make sure that external storage is mounted so that the app can work proplerly. Rebooting, removing cache and data, reinstalling, disabling PrivacyGuard didn't fix it. Best part: Reinstalling 1.1.2 from F-Droid now also yields the ‚ÄúNo external storage is available‚Äù message. Despite all this, it's nice to see the latest progress!

report.summary: Volume incremented on play.
report.label: bug
report.description: Whenever I press play, Antennapod raises the media volume by one level. Might be related to #313 Using v1.2.1

report.summary: Incorrect loading of a former session's fragment
report.label: bug
report.description: Some hiccups when trying to load the fragment in use before the app was stopped, e.g. pressing the download button in an episode's view often causes erroneous loading. Additionally (the former issue has already been fixed locally), I will try to restore the audio/video player activity.

report.summary: Grey text in "recently listened"
report.label: bug
report.description: All items in the "recently listened" view are grey. I guess grey text implies that the episode is not new and the user listened to it. The problem is with the dark theme the contrast of grey text on dark grey background is a bit low. And it does not make any sense to indicated if something was listened in a view that implies that all its elements aren't new.

report.summary: Cannot load next page for paged feeds
report.label: bug
report.description: For some reason I cannot get AntennaPod to load the second to nth page of the following feeds: http://feeds.feedburner.com/mobile-macs-podcast http://cre.fm/feed/mp3 http://logbuch-netzpolitik.de/feed/mp3 http://newz-of-the-world.com/feed/mp3 When I press on the next page button for the first time after opening a feed list, the UI jumps to the top of the list, when I press the button a second time, the UI just briefly shows the loading circle and then nothing happens. Please have a look at this issue because it is rather annoying not to be able to listen to podcast episodes which were published before a certain date.

report.summary: episode was downloaded even after disabling auto download
report.label: bug
report.description: I had added raumzeit podcast from Tim pritlove yesterday while on mobile. Removed the auto download directly after adding. Now (>30h after disabling) Antennapod fetched the newest episode. I don't think I was at wifi before. But why did that happen? Was it in a queue from adding the feed and waiting for wifi? I am not sure if this is related to #1009

report.summary: iTunes search doesn't work with Japanese Characters?
report.label: bug
report.description: From Google Play Store: Search for iTunes not good Japanese characters don't Recognition. (ex.„ÅÇ, „Ç´, Êº¢ etc...) This seems to be an issue on our end, since it works fine when I go to the URL manually via Chrome's address bar: https://itunes.apple.com/search?term=„ÅÇ

report.summary: Shownotes don't display line breaks
report.label: bug
report.description: Here's an example feed: http://feeds.soundcloud.com/users/soundcloud:users:82926214/sounds.rss Description gets rendered without any new lines in AnttenaPod and it looks really weird.

report.summary: Downloads a lot of data after update
report.label: bug
report.description: After I updated the app today it is saturating my downlink. So far it has downloaded over 1 GB. It doesn't download any podcasts as far as I can see. Nothing in the download log either. What kind of stuff is it downloading? Over 1 gig of stuff. I have all updates set to manual since forever. Thanks.

report.description: I just updated to 1.3, and I am getting a message stating that I have to have external storage mounted. However, my phone doesn't have support for external storage, this should be an option, as I cannot use Antennapod now My phone is a moto x 1st gen

report.summary: Bug in sleep timer when shake to reset is not set
report.label: bug
report.description: Last alpha release from yesterday (1.4.0.1) implemented shake to reset (and vibrate) in sleep timer. When shake to reset is not set antennapod dial down sound but do not stop playing. Beside you end up stuck with a low sound level. The only way to get back normal sound level is to set sleep timer with shake to reset and let it stop playing audio.

report.summary: Prestissimo has to be installed for Playback Speeds preference
report.label: bug
report.description: On last alpha release from yesterday (1.4.0.1) there is a new experimental built-in option to use sonic media player as replacement for prestissimo but you still need to have prestissimo installed. If you do not install it you can't set play speed option (It asks to download prestissimo) and you can't change speed in player view which do not have speed switch button.

report.summary: PROTOCOL_ERROR
report.label: bug
report.description: Recently I tried to listen to the System Mastery podcast. The feed's here: http://feeds.feedburner.com/SystemmasteryPodcasts?format=xml It's hosted on Wordpress. The feed loads fine but I get a PROTOCOL_ERROR in AntennaPod. I get the same error in Pocketcasts. The audio files download just fine with desktop clients, curl, etc. The System Mastery folks are at a loss as they didn't change anything, but were getting reports from their users things didn't work properly. I went looking around and found this issue: square/okhttp#1897 so it's possible that there is some change in Android 5.x that in combination with a server change (HTTP 2 support on part of Wordpress?) triggers this problem. I recently learned another podcast, Heavy Cardboard, also hosted on Wordpress, is experiencing very similar issues with Pocket Casts. According to them Pocket Casts is working on a fix but I figured I'd inform you too. http://feeds.feedburner.com/HeavyCardboardPodcast?format=xml

report.summary: Info not updated after reset playback position
report.label: bug
report.description: When resetting the playback position with the context menu in the queue, the info that is shown for that item doesn't get updated immediately. I.e.: AP doesn't replace the 'current play time' and progress bar with the space (MB) that the episodes takes. Info is updated after screen turns off (inactivity), after scrolling the item off-screen or changing screens (go to feed view, for example). Expected behaviour to give immediate feedback that the playback position was reset. AP v. 1.3.4.1 on Android 4.2.2

report.summary: Download retry loop when out of storage space
report.label: bug
report.description: My device went into a continuous loop of attempting to download a new episode and failing with the message "Insufficient Space". This also caused the Antennapod download notification to rapidly expand and collapse. I was able to get it to stop by going into the settings and disabling auto-download. Download log screenshot Solid Explorer is displaying memory usage as: Root: 97% (28.8 MB free) Internal Memory: 84% (1.97 GB free) This is on the 2013 Nexus 5. The feed url is: http://channel9.msdn.com/Shows/The-Defrag-Show/feed/mp3 I also saved a sample of the feed here: https://gist.github.com/dander/2330a550147b835fbebc The latest episode appears to be ~33 MB, however I think there may be a problem with the feed itself. Even after cleaning up some space, I am unable to download that episode, and the file shows up as 1B in the Queue. However, the download failure loop has stopped.

report.summary: OPML import from local filesystem doesn't work
report.label: bug
report.description: I re-installed antennapod and tried to import some feeds from a local OPML file but it didn't work. In the "OPML import" screen, I click on "From local filesystem", I get the "Complete action using..." popup dialog, I choose my usual file manager (Ghost Commander), navigate to the file, click on the file and nothing happens, I'm back in the "OPML import" screen again. I'm sure the OPML file is OK, importing podcasts from the very same file used to work in previous versions of antennapod (unfortunately I can't recall the exact version when it worked). Another small bug: if I repeat the import process, I always have to choose the external filemanager, even if I select "Always" in the "Complete action using..." popup dialog; so it seems antennapod is not keeping track of the choice. (BTW Importing from gpodder.net works)

Reproduce: make sure the episode is in the queue, go to the feed screen, long-press the episode to open the context menu Version: 1.4.2.2

report.summary: Problem with seeking in a particular podcast.
report.label: bug
report.description: Android version: 5.0.2 Device model: MEDION X5004 Expected behaviour: Seeking in any podcast episode should just work. Current behaviour: With one particular podcast, I have this problem that seeking beyond a certain position does not work correctly. The Podcast is Linux Voice, Season 3 Episode 22. When the podcast starts, I seek to a position beyond 35 minutes (e.g. 00:36:54). Then one of the following two things happen: Either the podcast stops as if it was hitting the end of the mp3-file. The next episode starts playing automatically. Or, and this is quite strange, the (visual) seeking succeeds, the new display time is 00:36:54 and continues to increase in every second (00:36:55, 00:36:56, ...), but the audio track is wrong. The audio that is played is from the start of the podcast episode (00:00:01, 00:00:02, ...). First occured: Version 1.4.2.2 / occurred sometime around 2015-12-23 Steps to reproduce: Subscribe to Linux Voice Podcast via iTunes. Download Season 3 Episode 22 Start playing the episode. Seek to position 00:35:00 or beyond. Repeat step 4 several times, until you see the above behavior. Environment (Settings you have changed, e.g. Auto Download. "Unusual" devices you use, e.g. Bluetooth headphones. Do you still use Prestissimo?): I have changed some setting, but can't remember what. I do not use any headphones or other devices with the phone. I do not have Prestissimo or any other related app (to my knowledge) installed.

report.summary: Changing playback speed unpauses playback
report.label: bug
report.description: When in the playback view, changing the playback speed unpauses playback. Reproduction steps: Staat playback Pause it in playback view Tap playback speed, a few times -> playback unpauses, play button doesn't change There are a few other oddities I noticed related to this. By my knowledge I only had 1x playback selected before the last few updates. After, I could change between 0.5 up to 2.0. I went into the menu, afterwards only between 1.0 and 2.0. Curious, I went to look at the specific setting and found a range of 1.1 to 2.0 enabled, all these ranges in steps of 0.1. Going back to the playback view it no longer went to 1.0, keeping to the range in the setting. I suppose something in the update did something strange, or that one time when I enabled sonic for a second. It's so strange a collection of bugs I doubt it'll be easily reproduceable. V. 1.5.0.2 Nexus 5 Android 6.0.1 Not using Sonic

report.summary: Playback speed option confusion
report.label: bug
report.description: I don't use different playback speeds so I have all but 1.00x disabled in the settings. Despite that, it still appears in the lower left corner, which isn't too bad but unnecessary. It however also still appears as a slider in the audio controls, where i can set it to anything still, though it gets ignored upon exit. I understand where this all comes from, but I feel like between the settings and the UI controls there is some excess of options. I can't think of a perfect solution, so I hope you will.

report.summary: Resuming incomplete downloads sometimes results in duplicated content
report.label: bug
report.description: Sometimes when downloading a file the download cannot complete for one reason or another. When the download is re-attempted / resumed, it eventually can succeed. The interesting bit is that when the file is finally played, it sometimes has a section of audio repeated around where the download failed and was restarted. That is, the audio plays, then at some point the last few seconds repeat. However, the issue is not the playback, as once the file is downloaded the repeating bit can always be reproduced. It is also possible that when the download is continued from being interrupted the resulting audio file may contain a section which is invalid and sounds like static when played for a brief moment around the section where the re-download occurred. This can be observed on AntennaPod 1.4.2.2 from F-Droid.

Happens even when there is plenty of disk space available on device. App version: 1.5.0.8 Fdroid Android version: 5.1.1 (CyanogenMod 12.1) Expected behaviour: Episode cache should never be full if set to unlimited Current behaviour: Icon showing episode cache as full when set to unlimited in settings First occurred: Update to 1.5.0.8 (from 1.4.2.2 Fdroid) Steps to reproduce: In Automatic download, set episode cache to unlimited. Look at sidebar to see that downloads shows "episode cache full" icon You can toggle between a number and unlimited in the automatic download setting to see the icon disappear/reappear.

report.summary: Play/pause button can stop working
report.label: bug
report.description: App version: 1.5.0.9 from F-Droid Android version: 4.4.4 Current behaviour: Play/pause button can stop working after the screen has turned off (after the screen is turned back on of course). First occured: Version 1.5 (worked on 1.4) Steps to reproduce: With the current episode in focus: Play something Turn off the screen Turn on the screen Pause (this works) Play/resume doesn't work AND Stop/pause playback Turn off the screen Turn on the screen Press play (this works) Pause doesn't work As a workaround, if you press back you get the currently playing episode at the bottom and the play/pause button there works. If you focus a different app before turning the screen off, turn the screen on and then focus AntennaPod again it works fine. So the problem occurs only when the app has focus (on the current episode). Environment: Do you still use Prestissimo? No, and I have tried Sonic on and off.

report.summary: Reordering episodes in queue causes mis-ordering, crashes
report.label: bug
report.description: When dragging episodes up or down in the queue, I often get crashes. If there is no crash, the queue frequently ends up out of order. Sometimes merely dragging an episode up or down one slot causes a crash. I have found at least one reproduction case. Suppose you start with episodes A, B, C, and D in order: -A -B -C -D Tap on A and start to drag down, so you should end up with B A C D When A's row gets to where you would expect it to swap with B, the app does one of two things: crashes immediately (I haven't figured out why this happens yet), or the remaining episodes all slide down another row (D pushing into a previously nonexistent row): -A -B -C -D If you continue to hold and drag A down, when it gets to B's new row, the app crashes. This reproduces for me 100%. I also am experiencing some bugginess moving an episode up, but haven't found a watertight repro case yet. Usually it manifests itself by moving the episode an extra space or two. Sometimes the app crashes. I noticed this in the last few days. I don't remember the exact first time, but I would guess no earlier than a week ago. AntennaPod version: I signed up for the beta some time ago, but am not sure if I'm actually getting beta builds. My App info says I have version 1.5.1.3 Android 5.1.1, Nexus 4

report.summary: Feed refresh not working properly
report.label: bug
report.description: App version: 1.5.2.0 (from Google Play), already had the issue in 1.4.2.2 Android version: 6.1 Device model: LG Nexus 5X Expected behaviour: On the "Episodes" Screen I click on the refresh button to check whether new episodes of my podcasts are available. In the status bar Antenna Pod shows a shrinking number of how many feeds still must be updated. After all feeds are updated it shows the message "processing downloads" and after this is closed all new episodes are shown in the "Episodes" Screen. Current behaviour: My feeds are not updated with this refresh function. Nevertheless an update on each feed still works. The message "processing downloads" persists. It seems to do something in the background all the time, because my battery is drained. The only chance to get rid of this is to kill Antenna Pod. First occured: Version 1.4.2.2 / about 4-6 weeks ago/ I'm using Antenna Pod since beginning of year 2016. I already had the same problem in the end of January. I reinstalled Antenna Pod (which fixed the problem). About 4 weeks later, it appeared again. A week later I had no problem anymore, now it appears again. Steps to reproduce: It happens every time I update my feeds. Before it happened the first time, this issue did not occure. I didn't change settings in-between. Environment: I'm using Prestissimo. No Auto-download, Auto-update feeds once a day. Stacktrace/Logcat: The way it described in this wiki, I couldn't get it to work on my phone.

Current behaviour: After a fresh (re)install, sync with gpodder restores only the feeds, but not the played episodes (all episodes of my 46 feeds are marked as unplayed) (I tried diving into the issues ; there are many related to gpodder sync issues but as far as I could see none pinpointing exactly my particular issue ‚àí feel free to merge in case I missed it).

report.summary: Swipe gestures in episode details - description not updated
report.label: bug
report.description: If you tap on an episode, you get a details view including (I assume) a WebView that displays the description. Swiping left/right switches to the next/previous episode, so it changes title, icon, feed title, duration,... The description gets reloaded (progress indicator visible) but it does not change to the description of the new episode you just switched to. This happens in the playlist as well as in the episodes list of a single feed.

report.summary: Threats of Crash on some Samsung devices
report.label: bug
report.description: Dear developers of AntennaPod, I am a student majoring in Computer Science. We are trying to collect existing bug reports and fixes of bugs caused by specific devices to help detect and fix similar bugs of other active applications. We have detected that in your app, method setSupportActionBar of android support library v7 is used in many activities. However, we have observed that invoking this method on some Samsung devices running 4.2 system will crash your app. We have found discussions in in the bug tracking system of Android: here. as well as a stack overflow question: appcompat-v7 v21.0.0 causing crash on Samsung devices with Android v4.2.2 A suggested fix for it is to add -keep class !android.support.v7.internal.view.menu.**,** {*;} to the proguard rules. I have seen the opposite rule to keep all the classes in android.support.v7 in your proguard file. Thank you vey much. Hope this information is useful for you.

report.summary: Possible causes of Hang-Bugs Found
report.label: bug
report.description:
Dear AntennaPod Developers, I am implementing a hang-bug detection tool and I am analyzing AntennaPod with it (master version downloaded yesterday). I tested the app with a Nexus 4 (Android 5.1) and Huawei P8 Lite (Android 4.4). I found that the main thread of Antennapod calls: android.database.sqlite.SQLiteCursor.getCount and android.app.SharedPreferencesImpl$EditorImpl.commit frequently when subscribing and opening podcasts. In particular, the above APIs are called as consequence of the two following calls: 1) de.danoeh.antennapod.activity.MainActivity.saveLastNavFragment -> android.app.SharedPreferencesImpl$EditorImpl.commit
2) de.danoeh.antennapod.core.storage.DBReader.getQueueIDList -> android.database.sqlite.SQLiteCursor.getCount In my experiments, the execution of those functions on the main thread may be the main cause of the eye-detectable delays (i.e., hang-bug) experienced with AntennaPod. As the developers guide of Android suggests, moving work off the main thread leads to higher responsiveness of the app. It is actually possible to move those two operations off the main thread using background threads. Therefore, do you think that the smoothness of the app would improve by executing those functions off the main thread? Thanks for any information, I hope I can help improve AntennaPod. üëç 2
