report.summary: HTML not rendered
report.label: bug
report.description: With RSS the feed description tag only allows plain text, but the equivalent in Atom is subtitle and that does allow HTML. In AntennaPod it gets parsed correctly, but when being viewed on either FeedInfo or OnlineFeedView activities it is just displayed in a textview. The best solution would be to render it in both places, I tried to do that but I don't understand the system in AntennaPod for displaying shownotes. If I could have, I would have done another pull request. The easier but more disappointing thing to do would be to trim the HTML like you do in the OnlineFeedViewActivity for shownotes.

report.summary: CircleCI builds fail intermittently
report.label: bug
report.description: Quite a few pull requests fail: I believe the build failures are specific to CircleCI, rather than the files changed. What could be done about it? Thanks. The affected pull requests include (at least): #2119, #2117, #2130, #2096 ... CircleCI errors: Your build has exceeded the memory limit of 4G on 1 container. The results of this build are likely invalid. We have taken a snapshot of the memory usage at the time, which you can find in a build artifact named memory-usage.txt. The RSS column in this file shows the amount of memory used by each process, measured in kilobytes.

report.summary: Random crashes in 1.6.2.2.
report.label: bug
report.description:
App version: 1.6.2.2 (from F-Droid) Android version: 4.2.2 Device model: Samsung Phone Expected behaviour: antennapod should not crash :) Current behaviour: as soon as I upgraded from 1.6.2.1 to 1.6.2.2, antennapod started crashing very often, with the popup message "Unfortunately antennapod has stopped". Sometimes it happens right after starting the app. Sometimes it happens right after pressing play on a podcast episode: the episode keeps playing in the background, but it stops as soon as I click "OK" to dismiss the popup message "Unfortunately... etc". Sometimes I can listen to a podcast, but it crashes right after I try to listen to a different episode. I never experienced this behaviour in any previous release; they all worked OK up to (and including) 1.6.2.1. I didn't make any changes to my configuration. (BTW, unfortunately it's not possible to downgrade directly from 1.6.2.2 to 1.6.2.1, the install procedure in F-Droid exits with an error; so one has to uninstall the app, and re-install it) Stacktrace/Logcat: Here's the content of crash-report.log I'm sorry I can't remember which kind of situation triggered this particular crash (at startup, or after pressing play); let me know if you need more details or examples and I'll try to get a crash log for each situation. [ Environment ] Android version: 4.2.2 OS version: 3.4.5-2814721 AntennaPod version: 1.6.2.2 Model: GT-S7580 Device: kylepro Product: kyleproxx

App version: 1.6.2.3 F-Droid Android version: 7.1.1 Devide model: bullhead (Nexus 5X) Steps to reproduce: Add a blogger feed such ADB See episode dates

report.summary: Playback progress bar is falsely filled after reopening the app
report.label: bug
report.description: For this bug to happen you have to stop playback somewhere in the middle, then stop the app. When you reopen the app the progress bar is completely filled, like if you stopped right at the end of the episode, although the progress should be somewhere in the middle. App version: 1.6.2.3 (from F-Droid) Android version: 7.1.2 (LineageOS April Build) Devide model: Samsung Galaxy S4 i9505 Expected behaviour: Progress bar should show the current playback position after reopening the app Current behaviour: Playback progress bar is completely filled First occured: Version 1.6.2.3 (first time I observed this) Steps to reproduce: Start playback of an episode Kill the app (it must be completely stopped) Open the app -> Progress bar is completely filled When you tap on the progress bar and then go back the playback position is set properly Environment: only difference to default is night theme Stacktrace/Logcat: n/a

report.summary: Queue section of expanded notification does not update until queue is empty
report.label: bug
report.description: App version: 1.6.2.3 (from Google Play) Android version: 7.1.2 [LineageOS 14.1, 20170522, N2G47O] Device model: LG Nexus 5X Expected behaviour: Expanded notification should contain: the currently playing podcast control buttons (all four) queue section with upcoming podcasts (up to 3). If only two more episodes are playing after the current podcast, expanded notfication should show currently playing podcast but only two items. If no podcast is in the queue, expanded notification should look like normal notification (but with additional control buttons) with no separate queue section. Etc. Etc. Etc. The ability to turn off or change the number of queue items displayed in the the queue section of the expanded notification would be nice also. This section takes up half of the screen, and even if functioning, it would be nice to be able to reduce the size of it. Maybe I am unclear as to the purpose of this section, because there are no options that deal with this queue section of the notification. Current behaviour: Expanded notification queue does not update in real time, and first three items will display until queue is empty. First occured: I have only been using AntennaPod for a week. Steps to reproduce: At the end of the day, I have listened to all podcasts, so queue is empty. Overnight, podcasts autodownload and are added to queue (more than 3 podcasts). When I start playing podcasts in the morning, The expanded notification shows the currently playing podcast and the queue section shows the currently playing podcast (again) and the next two queue items. These queue items will stay the same until queue is empty again.
